pr_title: Add Lombok and start separating content from information gathering

timeline.message:
Add Lombok and start separating content from information gathering

This is the first step to generate the Frank configuration schema, the
FrankDoc and the syntax 1.0 lookup compile-time. The plan is to
separate the logic to gather the relevant information from the
logic that writes the generated files.

timeline.bodyText: Ik kan mij voorstellen dat je lombok niet zelf hoeft te downloaden, omdat het ook al als dependency in het iaf-project zit. Je kan het vast ook runnen uit de maven-dependencies. Zou je dat kunnen checken?
timeline.author: gvanbrakel
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -102,10 +102,25 @@ If you are developing under Windows, you can do the following to set this up:
 
 ## Developing with Eclipse
 
+### Install Eclipse with Lombok
+
 - Download Eclipse from [Eclipse 2019-03](https://www.eclipse.org/downloads/packages/release/2019-03/r), choosing "Eclipse IDE for Enterprise Java Developers". Note that 64-bit Eclipse doesn't work with 32-bit JRE/JDK (doesn't start without any message). There is no installer. To install Eclipse, just unzip your download to a directory of your choice.
+- Browse to https://projectlombok.org/.
+- On the top menu, choose "Download". Download version 1.18.12. You may need the link "older versions".
+- Run the .jar you downloaded. Under Windows you can double-click it.

replies.bodyText:
Hello Gerrit,
If you want to use Maven's download, then you have to find the downloaded .jar. This is not easy in Eclipse, because Eclipse does not sort the libraries. Then downloading manually is easier.
replies.author: mhdirkse

timeline.message: Why not use Maven to download lombok
